article.headline: Iona 69, St. Peter's 50
article.story: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y. (AP) -- Devon Clarke scored 15 points and Iona beat St. Peter's 69-50 on Sunday to snap a five-game losing streak. Kyle Camper added 12 points for the Gaels (6-12, 2-4 Metro Atlantic), who led 42-27 at halftime and never trailed. Wesley Jenkins scored 15 points, and Todd Sowell had 12 points and 13 rebounds for the visiting Peacocks (4-12, 1-5), who committed 30 turnovers. The Gaels led 49-37 after Dexter Gray scored with 11:23 left in the game. Raul Orta hit two free throws with 6:13 remaining to cut the edge to 50-41, but the Peacocks came no closer.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
